DOC.brief_summary: The primary purpose study examine effect 1-week overeat important clinical metabolic health outcome ( e.g. , glucose tolerance , blood lipid profile , blood pressure ) factor regulate structure metabolic function fat tissue . This study determine regular exercise overeat period impact response .
DOC.detailed_description: If subject eligible decide participate , take part two identical study trial . One schedule schedule 1 week overeat control study team . Subjects exercise regularly instructed exercise day first study trial - require exercise 6 7 day overeat period ( include day second study trial ) . Subjects regularly exercise ( planned physical activity ) remain inactive completion study trial . Before study trial If subject regular exerciser , ask come Substrate Metabolism Laboratory afternoon 2 study trial exercise lab 45 min moderate intensity . The evening study trial , subject need eat standardized dinner meal snack . They must eat meal snack specific time indicated research staff . After eat snack , subject need fast ( food beverage - besides water ) overnight . During study trial Subjects arrive Substrate Metabolism Laboratory 7:00AM rest quietly approximately 30 min . After , study team measure rest blood pressure rest metabolic rate . An intravenous catheter ( IV ) place vein subject 's hand forearm blood sampling . The research team collect small sample fat tissue subject 's abdomen needle . Next , subject drink sweet sugar solution Oral Glucose Tolerance Test ( OGTT ) research team collect blood sample every 15 min 3 hour . After 3 hour test , IV catheter remove subject provide breakfast discharged .
DOC.criteria: Age : 1840 Body Mass Index : 2030 kg/m2 Exercise group : ( â‰¥5 days/wk aerobic exercise ; 3060min/session moderate vigorous intensity ) No Exercise group : regularly plan exercise/physical activity Women must regularly occur menses must premenopausal Pregnant lactate Blood pressure > 140/90 mm Hg Evidence/history cardiovascular metabolic disease Medications know affect lipid glucose metabolism Tobacco electronic cigarette user
